newsitem.title: UK: UK's Minet says no staff meetings on future.
newsitem.headline: UK's Minet says no staff meetings on future.

text.p: UK broker Minet, a part of U.S. insurance group St Pauls Cos, said market talk that senior executives were being called to a meeting to discuss the company's future were untrue.
"I am not aware of that meeting," chief executive Peter Christie told Reuters, adding that no meetings were taking place to inform employees about major changes.
St Pauls brought in Goldman Sachs last August to assist in examining strategic alternatives for the London based international insurance broker.
Industry sources believe St Pauls plans to sell the broker, with Marsh & McLennan Cos Inc tipped as the likely buyer.
Christie said he was "not unaware of such rumours," but added that he had no comment to make on them. "We will only comment when there is a news release."
